channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Character.ai Faces Lawsuit After Teen’s Suicide
item.description: The mother of a 14-year-old Florida boy says he became obsessed with a chatbot on Character.AI before his death.

item.title: Mark Cuban says Donald Trump is not Kamala Harris’ main rival anymore—it’s Elon Musk
item.description: Elon Musk takes lead in Republican race to presidency.

item.title: White Blobs Wash Up on Canada’s Beaches, Stumping Everyone
item.description: Over a month after the substance began appearing on the southern shores of Newfoundland, a federal agency is still investigating.

item.title: White Blobs Wash Up on Canada’s Beaches, Stumping Everyone
item.description: Over a month after the substance began appearing on the southern shores of Newfoundland, a federal agency is still investigating.

item.title: Why Nextdoor’s founder moved back into the company C-suite
item.description: It's essential that CEOs step back and 'harmonize...the evolution of your company with the evolution of what's going on outside,' said Nextdoor CEO Ni...

item.title: Gunmen in Turkey Launch Deadly Attack on Aerospace Company
item.description: Surveillance footage showed two attackers, a man and a woman, with backpacks and rifles and a body lying on the pavement outside.

item.title: Live Updates: Israel Strikes Southern Lebanon as Blinken Visits Mideast
item.description: Israel said it had attacked Hezbollah targets in the ancient city of Tyre, pressing on with its military campaign despite U.S. efforts to tamp down co...

item.title: Stuffed Into Trucks, 78 Thai Protesters Died. Their Killers Are Still Free.
item.description: Twenty years ago, a massacre in southern Thailand fueled an insurgency that has never stopped. If no one is prosecuted for it by Friday, no one ever w...

item.title: What Drugmakers Did Not Tell Volunteers in Alzheimer’s Trials
item.description: Genetic tests showed that certain patients were predisposed to brain injuries if they took the drugs. That information remained secret.

item.title: Fernando Valenzuela, Pitcher Whose Screwballs Eluded Batters, Dies at 63
item.description: The Los Angeles Dodgers star won the Rookie of the Year and Cy Young Awards in 1981, when “Fernandomania” made him a household name and filled ballpar...

item.title: With JetBlue out of the picture, Frontier and Spirit Airlines are once again discussing a merger—two years after their $2.9 billion deal fell through
item.description: The two carriers have held off-and-on discussions since 2016.

item.title: Rohingya Refugees Are Stranded at Sea for Days as Residents Reject Them
item.description: Residents of a town in western Indonesia shared food with the refugees but declined to host them, leaving them stuck on a boat miles from shore.

item.title: McDonald’s president is confident you can still ‘enjoy the classics,’ despite ongoing investigation of E. coli outbreak from the famed Quarter Pounders
item.description: The CDC's ongoing investigation has documented 49 cases, 10 hospitalizations, and one death across 10 states.

item.title: U.S. Study on Puberty Blockers Goes Unpublished Because of Politics, Doctor Says
item.description: The leader of the long-running study said that the drugs did not improve mental health in children with gender distress and that the finding might be ...

item.title: Russian operatives are targeting Tim Walz, spreading viral disinformation about his time as a teacher
item.description: Digital researchers had already linked the video to Russia, but this is the first time federal authorities have confirmed the connection.
